messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 753
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/1/00 9:07:19 AM Pacific Daylight Time, MorelFam@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/1/00 9:07:19 AM Pacific Daylight Time, MorelFam@...
writes:

<< i know you know this, but dont forget the library! thats how i read
llewellyns books... very empowering! and loved unschooling handbook too,
especially for beginning unschoolers >>


You are so right. I think my problem is that my local library doesn't have
many homeschooling books and I'm usually out for immediate gratification.
Sometimes I go to the bookstore instead of just ordering from another library
branch. Talk about shortsighted!
candice

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 753
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/31/00 7:18:37 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/31/00 7:18:37 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< "The Teenage Liberation Handbook - How to quit
school
and get a real life and education" by Grace Llewellyn. It's fabulous!!

Anyone here read that one?
>>

That is one I've been meaning to read. I hear great things about it, but I've
been on a book budget lately >>

i know you know this, but dont forget the library! thats how i read
llewellyns books... very empowering! and loved unschooling handbook too,
especially for beginning unschoolers...
erin
